Label: material fact
Sentence: Securities and Exchange Board of India (hereinafter referred to as “SEBI”) conducted investigation in trading in the scrip of M s Flawless Diamond India Limited (hereinafter referred to as ‘FDIL’ ‘Company’) which is listed on Bombay Stock Exchange (hereinafter referred to as ‘BSE’).

Label: material fact
Sentence: The period of investigation in the scrip of FDIL was from June 2006 to February 2007 (hereinafter referred to as ‘Investigation Period’).

Label: allegation
Sentence: The findings of the investigation led to the allegation that M s Akanksha Holdings Private Limited (hereinafter referred to as ‘AHPL’ ‘Noticee’) had violated the provisions of regulation 13(3) read with regulation 13(5) of SEBI (Prohibition of Insider Trading) Regulations, 1992 (hereinafter referred to as ‘PIT Regulations’) and therefore consequently, liable for monetary penalty under section 15A(b) of the SEBI Act.

Label: procedural fact
Sentence: The undersigned has been appointed as Adjudicating Officer vide order dated March 23, 2011 under section 15 I of SEBI Act read with rule 3 of SEBI (Procedure for Holding Inquiry and Imposing Penalties by Adjudicating Officer) Rules, 1995 (hereinafter referred to as ‘Rules’) to inquire into and adjudge the alleged violations of provisions of PIT Regulations.

Label: procedural fact
Sentence: Show Cause Notice No EAD-7 PB AK 16986 2011 dated May 27, 2011 (hereinafter referred to as “SCN”) was issued to the Noticee under rule 4(1) of the Rules to show cause as to why an inquiry should No be initiated and penalty be No imposed under section 15A(b) of SEBI Act for the alleged violation specified in the said SCN.

Label: procedural fact
Sentence: The said SCN was sent through courier and was delivered to the Noticee.

Label: allegation
Sentence: It was alleged in the SCN that, the shareholding of the Noticee in FDIL for the quarter ending March 2007 was 3,81,990 shares i.e. 6.60% of total shareholding of FDIL consisting of 57,90,000 shares.

Label: material fact
Sentence: During the June 2007 quarter FDIL had converted the warrants into shares which resulted in increase in share capital of FDIL to 1,44,78,000 shares.

Label: material fact
Sentence: Further, upon selling 1,00,491 shares of FDIL in market during the June 2007 quarter by the Noticee and because of the conversion of warrants into shares, the shareholding of the Noticee decreased to 2,81,499 shares i.e. 1.94% of total shareholding of FDIL.

Label: allegation
Sentence: It was alleged that as there was a change of more than 2% of shareholding of the Noticee in FDIL, the Noticee was required to make the disclosures to the company i.e. FDIL, in accordance with the provisions of regulation 13(3) read with regulation 13(5) of PIT Regulations i.e. within four working days from the date of selling, which the Noticee had failed to do.

Label: allegation
Sentence: Therefore, it was alleged that Noticee had violated the provisions of regulation 13(3) read with regulation 13(5) of PIT Regulations.

Label: procedural fact
Sentence: In the interest of natural justice and in order to conduct an inquiry in terms of rule 4(3) of the Rules, the Noticee was granted an opportunity of personal hearing on July 19, 2011, vide notice dated July 05, 2011 sent through SPAD to the Noticee.

Label: procedural fact
Sentence: The said hearing notice was delivered to the Noticee. Mr. Balveer Singh Choudhary, Choudhary & Singhvi, Chartered Accountants, Authorized Representative, (hereinafter referred to as “AR”) appeared on behalf of the Noticee.

Label: material fact
Sentence: During the hearing, the AR reiterated the submissions made vide letter dated July 02, 2011 and stated inter alia as under: “I deny the charges leveled against the Noticee in the SCN.

Label: material fact

Label: material fact
Sentence: On account of conversion of warrants by the company on April 24, 2007 the total shareholding of the company increased to 1,44,78,000 shares due to which the shareholding of the Noticee (3,81,990 shares i.e. 2.64% of the total shareholding of the company) fell below 5%.

Sentence: Noticee had sold 1,00,491 equity shares (0.69% of the total shareholding of the company) of the company in June 2007.

Label: issues framed
Sentence: I have carefully perused the submissions of the Noticee and the documents available on record. The issues that arise for consideration in the present case are :

Label: issues framed
Sentence: a. Whether Noticee had violated the provisions of regulation 13(3) read with regulation 13(5) of PIT Regulations?

Label: issues framed
Sentence: b. Does the violation, if any, attract monetary penalty under section 15A(b) of the SEBI Act?

Label: issues framed

Label: statutory fact
Sentence: Before moving forward, it is pertinent to refer to the relevant provisions of PIT Regulations, which reads as under:- 13. Disclosure of interest or holding by directors and officers and substantial shareholders in a listed company – Initial Disclosure Initial Disclosure (1) ………………. (2)………………. Continual disclosure (3) Any person who holds more than 5% shares or voting rights in any listed company shall disclose to the company [in Form C] the number of shares or voting rights held and change in shareholding or voting rights, even if such change results in shareholding falling below 5%, if there has been change in such holdings from the last disclosure made under sub- regulation (1) or under this sub-regulation; and such change exceeds 2% of total shareholding or voting rights in the company.

Label: statutory fact
Sentence: (5) The disclosure mentioned in sub-regulations (3) and (4) shall be made within 4 working days of : (a) the receipts of intimation of allotment of shares, or (b) the acquisition or sale of shares or voting rights, as the case may be.

Label: statutory fact
Sentence: Disclosure by company to stock exchanges (6)………………..

Label: statutory fact
Sentence: As per regulations 13 (3) & 13(5) of PIT Regulations, any person who is holding more than 5% of shares or voting rights in any listed company has to make the required disclosure to the company if there is any change in shareholding of such person by more than 2% of total shareholding or voting rights in the company, in a prescribed format, within 4 working days from (a) the receipt of intimation of allotment of shares or (b) the acquisition of shares or voting rights, as the case may be.

Label: material fact
Sentence: Upon perusal of the documents available on record I find that, the shareholding of the Noticee in FDIL for the quarter ending March 2007 was 3,81,990 shares i.e. 6.60% of total share capital of the company consisting of 57,90,000 shares for the quarter ending March 2007.

Label: material fact
Sentence: During June 2007 quarter, i.e. on April 24, 2007, FDIL had converted the warrants into shares which resulted in increase in share capital of FDIL from 57,90,000 shares to 1,44,78,000 shares.

Label: material fact
Sentence: Further, Noticee upon selling 1,00,491 shares of FDIL in market during June 2007 quarter and because of increase in share capital of the company on account of conversion of warrants into shares, the shareholding of the Noticee decreased to 2,81,499 shares i.e. 1.94% of total share capital of the company consisting of 1,44,78,000 shares for the quarter ending June 2007.

Label: material fact
Sentence: Further, in the instant case, I find that Noticee had No disputed the fact that it had sold 1,00,491 shares of FDIL in market during June 2007 quarter.

Label: material fact
Sentence: However, it is observed from the submissions of the Noticee that it had sold 50,000 shares i.e. 0.86% of total share capital of the company consisting of 57,90,000 shares on April 10, 2007, 491 shares i.e. 0.01% of total share capital of the company consisting of 57,90,000 shares on April 12, 2007, 25,000 shares i.e. 0.17% of total share capital of the company consisting of 1,44,78,000 shares (expanded pursuant to conversion of warrants to shares) on June 26, 2007 and 25,000 shares i.e. 0.17% of total share capital of the company consisting of 1,44,78,000 shares on June 27, 2007.

Label: material fact
Sentence: Thus, Noticee had sold 50,491 shares i.e. 0.87% of total share capital of the company consisting of 57,90,000 shares before conversion of warrants and 50,000 shares i.e. 0.34% of total share capital of the company consisting of 1,44,78,000 shares after conversion of warrants.

Label: subjective observation
Sentence: Thus, from the above it is observed that Noticee had No sold more than 2% of shares of FDIL at any point of time or in totality.

Label: subjective observation
Sentence: Further, it is observed that the decrease in shareholding of the Noticee by 2% during the quarter ending June 2007 was because of increase in share capital of company on account of conversion of warrants into shares on April 24, 2007 and No due to selling of 1,00,491 shares.

Label: subjective observation
Sentence: Thus, in the light of above, I find merit in the submissions of the Noticee and I am inclined to give benefit of doubt to the Noticee.

Label: subjective observation
Sentence: Therefore, the allegation of violation of regulation 13(3) read with regulation 13(5) of PIT Regulations does No stand established.

Label: subjective observation
Sentence: In view of the foregoing, the alleged violation of the provisions of regulation 13(3) read with regulation 13(5) of PIT Regulations by the Noticee, as specified in the SCN dated May 27, 2011 does No stand established and the matter is, accordingly, disposed of.
